addressleaf.section:
To my honorable frind S
r
Rob
t
Sidney knight, L. Gouverno
r
of
e towne of Flushing

page.lettertext:
fol.263r
S
r
Tho Bodley to S
r
Robert Sydney
S
r
, for as muche as yo
w
had written, to have
her
Ma
ties
l
re
addressed unto me, and it hath bin
not w
t
standing consigned to yo
r
self, w
t
out any
thing to me, of any such mater: and because in
very truth, I am utterly unaquainted w
t
any
part of those affaires, ether touching
e provision
of powder sent unto yow, or
e state of those places,
that yow require to be fortified, or other particu-
larities c
o
tained in
e l
re
, In my c
o
ceat
conceat
it was
intended,
at as maters appertaining to yo
r
owne
charge, and wherin yow could best pleade for her
Ma
ties
right, and answear all objections, they should
be folowed by yo
r
self: as me thinkes
e l
re
it
self, doth expresse it very plainely, by referring
them unto yow. For in me, yow knowe, it were not
grace, to present a l
re
publickly, w
ch
is not sent unto
me, and wherein I am not named, (as I am alwaies
in all,
at I am willed to exhibit) and of
e subject
wherof I am nothing so informed as
at I am able,
to answear and replie, and debate it w
t
them, as is
fitte. In w
ch
respect, lest
e l
re
should miscarie
w
t
wandring too and fro, I will retaine it w
t
me
heere,
at if yo
r
leasure and c
o
moditie will serve
therunto, it may be presented by yo
r
self in person;
if not, I should wishe yow to write to
e
G
na
l
General
states
,
and signifie some reason of yo
r
not coming hither,
and such mater w
t
all, as yow shall thinke expedient,
for
e furtherance of yo
r
business: whereupon I will
take order,
at her Ma
ties
l
re
together w
t
yo
wrs
shall
be delivered to
e President of their college, and
that they shall be solicited for an answear out of
hande: w
ch
is
e very best course,
at I think up
o
yet, to be taken in yo
r
behalf. The copie of
e
l
re
I return heere inclosed. As yet I have no
answear to my last dispatche into
England,
nor a
scrappe, of any newes, that is worth yo
r
paines to read it
for w
ch
I leave yow saluted and resoluted very hartely.
Fr
o
e Hage
De
c
17 15
5
95
Yo
r
most affectionat frind to doe yow service Tho. Bodley
